column4: I want to install the GTK engine Clearlooks, there is one in the repos, but its marked as "virtual" and I cannot install it - whats this?!
GTK Clearlooks is provided by another package
so why is it listed in aptitude then? whats that for?
sometimes several packages have the exact same files... to prevent a conflict - we have "virtual" packages that act as a master package.
for example: xsplash-artwork is a virtual package - and it's "child" packages (that provide it) are ubuntu-xsplash-artwork and sability-xsplash-artwork.
but other packages don't depend on the child package - instead they depend on the master.
can anyone tell me what package enables fancy mouse gestures for mousepads?
not too sure, but you could try: apt-cache search mouse gestures
to query the packages in the repository
only seems to be a Firefox addon
im not talkign about firefox mouse gestures. im talking about these apple-gestures (two fingers scroll etc)
oh, I'm pretty sure I saw a two finger scroll option in the Gnome Mouse preferences
btw: do I need to install a separate package besides compiz and metacity-common to make gnome remember the maximized state of a window after it got closed?
